gurmukhi: lY clXo bBICn BRwq ieh bwl puqR DUsr brn ]
transliteration: Lai Chadyo Babhichhan Bhraat Eh Baal Poutra Dhoosar Baran||
translation: That earthen-coloured Angad left the court of Ravana alongwith Vibhishan.

gurmukhi: Bt htk ibkt iqh nw sky cil AwXo ijq rwm rn ]378]
transliteration: Bhat Hatak Bikat Tih Na Sake Chal(i) Aayo Jit Raam Ran||378||
translation: When the demons tried to obstruct him, he routed and destroyed them and winning the battle in favour of Ram, he came to him.378.

gurmukhi: kih bulXo lMkys qwih pRB rwjIv locn ]
transliteration: Kah(i) Hulayo Lankes Taah(i) Prabh Raajeev Lochannd|
translation: Angad said on reaching, “O lotus-eyed Ram ! the king of Lanka has called you for war.”

gurmukhi: kutl Alk muK Cky skl sMqn duK mocn ]
transliteration: Koutal Alak Moukh Chhake Sakal Santan Doukh Mochannd|
translation: At that time some curly locks of hair were walking and looking at the beauty of his anguished face;

gurmukhi: kupY srb kiprwj ibjY phlI rx c`KI ]
transliteration: Koupai Sarab Kapiraaj Bijai Pahliran Chakkhee||
translation: The monkeys who had been victorious over Ravana earlier, were highly enraged on listening to the word of Angad about Ravana.

gurmukhi: iPrY lMk giV Gyir idsw d`CxI pr`KI ]
transliteration: Phirai Lank Gad(i) Gher(i) Disaa Dahchhanidarakkhee||
translation: They marched towards the South in order to advance towards Lanka.

gurmukhi: pRB krY bBICn lMkpiq suxI bwiq rwvx Grix ]
transliteration: Prabh Darai Babheechhan Lankpat(i) Sounibaat(i) Raavan Gharan(i)||
translation: When, on this side Mandodari, the wife of Ravana, learnt about the scheme of Ram for making Vibhishana the king of Lanka,

gurmukhi: su`iD s`q q`ib ibsrq BeI igrI Drx pr huAY ibmx ]379]
transliteration: Suddh(i) Satt Tabb(i) Bisrat Bhaigiridharan Par Huai Biman||379||
translation: She fell down unconscious on the earth.379.

gurmukhi: sUrbIrw sjy Gor bwjy bjy Bwj kMqw suxy rwm Awey ]
transliteration: Soorbeeraa Saje Ghor Baaje Bade Kantaa Soune Raam Aae||
translation: The warriors are decorating themselves and the horrible battle-drums are resounding, O my husband ! You may flee for your safety because Ram has arrived;

gurmukhi: bwl mwrXo blI isMD pwtXo ijnY qwih sO bYir kYsy rcwey ]
transliteration: Baal Mdaryo Balisindh Paatyo Jinai Taah(i) Bair(i) Kaise Rachaae||
translation: He who has killed Bali, who has splitted the sea and created the passage, why have you created enmity with him?

gurmukhi: bXwD jIqXo ijnY jMB mwrXo aunY rwm Aauqwr soeI suhwey ]
transliteration: Byaadh Jeetyo Jinai Janbh Mdaryo Ounai Raam Aoutaar Soisuhaae||
translation: He, who has killed Byadh and Jambasur, it is the same power, which has manifested itself as Ram;

gurmukhi: dy imlo jwnkI bwq hY isAwn kI cwm ky dwm kwhy clwey ]380]
transliteration: De Milo Jaanakibaat Siaan Kikichaam Ke Daam Kaahe Chadhaae||380||
translation: Return Sita to him and see him, this is the only wise thing, do not try to introduce the coins of leather.380.
